relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Bang for the buck
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

During orientation you receive a lot of information based on campus safety. there is a health clinic that can assist you when you're sick and an on campus pharmacy. UCF has a link with the police system that can help you when you are in need. UCF it self has golf carts that can take you through campus late at night when you don't want to walk alone. The police also has set up phone lines through out campus that you can press a button and the cops will respond instantly if you are in need of help.

There is literally a club for anything. Rock climbing, chocolate, salsa, Napping, and a Will bowling League! And if there isn't a club for it you can make it! all you need is yourself and 11 other people who share your interest and a sponsor. they are very helpful on campus for this.
Any one and everyone is welcomed at UCF! they are very diverse and have something for everyone.
The best tradition is spirit splash, and tailgating where they close off the campus for one huge party.

UCF is awesome with clubs and events. they host alot of free concerts in the arena, comedy nights with people like Tosh.0 and Anjelah Johnson have previously attended. Also there is always someone walking around handing out free stuff; Sunglasses, free ticket info; pringles. you name it!

UCF offers a lot of fun activities through out the year. Pegasus Palooza occurs during the first week of school and has lots of free stuff, concerts, comedy nights for freshman and current students. Th most know and highly anticipated event is the Spirit Splash which is the one and only day everyone is allowed to splash into the fountain in the middle of campus and collect one of the oh so famous rubber duckies!

UCF has several dining options all over campus. From the student union, marketplace, breezeway and Knightros you have several different selctions. You can get a quick bit like pizza, Pita, smoothies or Chick-Fil-a near the center of campus or go to buffet style market place where there is salad pizza, sandwiches and self serve ice cream (my favorite) Knightro's is a similar like location. And if you're Hispanic like me they have a Hispanic food night which taste just like home!

I am not staying at a on campus dorm but hearing from other students dorm life is fun and comfortable. The RA's help you with any situation in your dorm and each floor usually has fun activities specific to your floor to have fun and make dorm living a little more fun.

UCF offers many course that are rigorous yet do-able. During Orientation current students and academic advisers help you select the right course you need for your intended major and help you figure out the right schedule and classes that will work best for you.

Work hard during high school to receive the best grades and pass as many AP course available to you. UCF is a large campus but not so easy to get lost. They're lots of friendly faces around ready to assist you with anything you need. Go check out the campus before or when you apply to get a good feel for it.

UCF is a large dynamic campus.It has plenty of available resource for every student from study groups, writing assistance and tons of free stuff! I recently went to my freshmen orientation and was surprised by all the information given; it really opened my eyes to all the available resources.
pageTitle: University of Central Florida (UCF) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {988272=I can't say much, here, other than I've never felt unsafe while on campus. There have been a few crime reports, but mostly off campus, in the apartments, when someone got robbed. UCF does a good job of alerting students when a crime occurs and giving safety tips. Also, starting Fall 2012, UCF will be a smoke-free campus., 31485=With costs rising and funding dropping, UCF is starting to have trouble with the amount of aid it used to give. Still, the college is dedicated to finding solutions to the difficult financial times without putting too much burden on the students. Bright Futures is a huge help for in-state students, but most students with whom I have spoken on the subject also received varying degrees of financial aid, from partial tuition to full tuition AND room-and-board. As a hint, though, they LOVE national merit semi-finalists, finalists, and scholars. One semi-finalist I knew received around $8000 per year on TOP of a full tuition scholarship from the college AND full bright futures from the state! She is EARNING money by attending, as the extra defaults to her account. She can use it for books, school supplies, and sometimes just living expenses, which is fantastic. They also offer many kinds of grants and loans for financial need, even if your GPA has taken a hit from your financial situation. My neighbor has received several subsidized loans from the government and the school and is managing to keep his out-of-pocket expenses down to between $800 and $1500 per year even though he didn't qualify for too much merit-based scholarship money. There is a great opportunity for students here to save money and still get a great education from knowledgeable and enthusiastic professors and assistants., 992273=I was an English- Creative Writing major in the honors program, and most semesters were tough. During my first semester as a junior, I had an average of 300 pages to read a week! Of course, 1000 and 2000 level courses aren't as rigorous., 114168=Moderately active. Many different Greek organizations to choose from, if that's your thing. 100% no hazing policy and few legitimately concerning stories (that is, stories beyond that of a pillow fight gotten rough, harmless pranks, or of sending the pledge to buy 1000 condoms) ever really heard., 1117152=On the Friday of homecoming week we have spirit splash. It was name best campus tradition in 2011. They have a Live DJ, special guest, and free stuff while students are allowed to go into the fountain located in front of the library. It is a crazy wet day., 654705=the homecoming week. spirit spirit spirit. in 2011, for the homecoming concert, the sga booked lupe fiasco and panic at the disco. unbelievable concert.there is also something called spirit splash at ucf where everyone jumps into the reflection pond for one day. sports are a huge deal here especially football and basketball, be sure to go out to the games, lots of fun., 992704=If you want to contact UCF, I suggest using email instead of the phone whenever possible. Replies are always prompt and informative, and you don't have to go through the hassle of being redirected and put on hold. If you have to park on campus, take early classes. If you arrive by 8:30 AM, you'll pretty much have your pick of spots. Join the Burnett Honors College as an honors student, honors in the major student, or both. You'll have early access to classes, and the opportunity to take small honors classes. Watch what classes you take in the same semester. Try to balance more rigorous courses with easier ones, but watch out. Some classes that seem easy can actually be tough! Take online classes. They're amazingly flexible, and usually easier than lecture classes., 62540=Program SEPS (safety escort and patrol services) number into your phone if you have classes that let out after 7:00. They are wonderful people, and I'm really glad that I used their services. Carry a jacket with you. It might be hot outside, but the classrooms are generally way too cold. Watch out for longboarders. Not all of them know what they are doing. Avoid campus on game days, if at all possible. It's absolutely insane., 19080=The University of Central Florida is a very large school. With over 50,000 students attending classes at the main campus or one of their satellite campuses, and almost 1500 acres of land on the main campus alone, it is safe to say that UCF is one of the larger universities in the nation. That being said, in most of your classes you will be one of the three or four hundred students sitting in your classroom. The easiest way for you to make the most of your learning experience at UCF is to always sit in the front five or six rows of the class and GET TO KNOW YOUR PROFFESSORS. Remember that you will probably only represent .003% of the student body sitting in that auditorium sized classroom. The teachers, for the most part, are very willing to help and they are very good at what they do. However, if you don’t ask for help and get to know your professors you will soon find yourself barely scraping by and doing poorly in the majority of your classes. Other great resources to help you learn more is to take advantage of the free tutoring, especially those offered by SARC (Student Academic Resource Center). If you follow this advice you will do wonderfully in all your classes and will definitely learn a lot., 263080=Fall 2013, the Neptune community will be built, brand new, very spacious and comfortable., 371797=I recommend living on campus. This is the best way to fully immerse yourself in UCF life. For freshmen students, the LINK program is an awesome way to meet new people and learn everything about the school. There are events every month where you earn LINK loot, redeemable at the end of semester auction for cool prizes like a $1300 scholarship and a year subscription of Netflix. I didn't take full advantage of this first semester but I certainly will in the spring., 802971=Lake Claire allows students to rent paddle boats/kayaks/canoes for free; it's located on campus at the end of Greek Park Drive. I go there on weekends sometimes. Every year in April UCF students are given 1 free ticket to Universal's Islands of Adventure. Athletic events are free, except for football games., 856744=UCF has a beautiful campus and most of the buildings are new. The gym is enormous and has a Subway restaurant inside, as well as an indoor track, basketball courts, an abundance of workout equipment, and several televisions to keep you entertained while you're sculpting yourself into shape. The dorm rooms for freshmen on campus are generally of good size and available for around $2000-$3000., 350780=Scholarships, average 1227 SA.T. score, average 27 A.C.T score. average High school GPA 3.8, 861178=nearly 1000 people run into a knee deep water fountain every year,, 421338=Don't take online classes your first semester! And take school as seriously as you can. This is the time where everyone wants to go out and party, and that's one hundred percent OK, but don't let it interfere with attending class and getting your work done! And avoid Alafaya Trail around 5:45 pm on weekdays, the traffic is terrible! And don't try to park on Campus between 10:30 and 1:30, there are never any parking spots! Take advantage of all of the free resources available, the gym, the health center, tutors, etc!, 1053170=I can't really say anything about this one because I haven't started class at UCF yet, I start June 25th., 175602=Surprisingly, as an out-of-state student you would think that the cost would be prohibitive compared to staying in state. I was accepted at both Penn State University main campus and UCF. Penn State 2010/2011 tuition is $14,412 and UCF non-Florida resident tuition is $19,832. Penn State did not offer any scholarship tuition assistance, but UCF offered me a $30,000 Knights Achievement Award scholarship! It was an easy decision for me when you add in the Florida sunshine and the fact that major theme parks and beaches are all within an hour's drive. You are not only getting a good education for your buck, but an amazing college life to go with it., 159602=I cannot stress this enough, APPLY EARLY!!! I applied ridiculously early (October, I believe) and got my acceptance letter literally a week later. While some of my other friends waited to apply and either got wait-listed or ended up getting accepted so late that it was even too late to apply for on-campus housing, forcing her to live off-campus by herself. Another thing (for those high school juniors), start taking the ACT/SAT the beginning of your junior year. I took my 3rd ACT the beginning of summer before senior year, that way, I was able to start filling out applications right when senior year started. You'll be so glad to just get those out of the way!}

textAfterTable: Ledesha from Orlando, FL 07/22/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 51 out of 52 people found this review useful. 3 of 738 Categories Comments Great for these types of students UCF is not a good school for any one particular type of student, its good for anyone who feels like it’s a fit. It’s really up to you to decide that for yourself. Go to the campus look at the classrooms and see if you can see yourself there. Talk to some of the students and ask them if they like it. Evaluate what you want for the rest of your life and see if UCF will help you get there. Only you can decide which schools will work for you and which won’t. Going to college is a big step, so don’t rush the decision to choose a college. Be true to yourself and what you want for the rest of your life and everything will work out fine.
